Agency.Name: Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) - Richmond
Agency.AgencyDescription: Delivers health care and support services through a network of health centres, hospitals, primary care clinics, residential care homes, and other facilities. Services include home health, mental health and substance use, health protection, public health, acute care, and other specialized programs. Free <strong>Take Home Naloxone Kits</strong> (Narcan) used to reverse the effects of overdoses from opioids (like fentanyl, heroin, methadone, morphine, and oxycodone), are available at all hospitals, public health units, mental health and substance use offices, and other facilities throughout the health authority region. Office hours are 8:30 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Fraserview Intermediate Care Lodge
Site.SiteDescription: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

SiteService.Name: Fraserview Intermediate Care Lodge
SiteService.Description: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

Site.Name: Richmond Lions Manor
Site.SiteDescription: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

SiteService.Name: Richmond Lions Manor
SiteService.Description: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

Site.Name: Public Health - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Provides public health nursing services. <strong>Prenatal and Early Years</strong> services include prenatal nutrition and lifestyle information; education and information on pregnancy and childbirth; postpartum support, including physical and emotional well-being for mothers and babies; breastfeeding assessment and support; and child health clinics and immunizations. <strong>School-age Health</strong> services include immunization, health promotion, and nutrition education, as well as vision, hearing, speech, and dental screening. Services are coordinated through local school districts; no referral is required. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Public Health - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Provides public health nursing services. <strong>Prenatal and Early Years</strong> services include prenatal nutrition and lifestyle information; education and information on pregnancy and childbirth; postpartum support, including physical and emotional well-being for mothers and babies; breastfeeding assessment and support; and child health clinics and immunizations. <strong>School-age Health</strong> services include immunization, health promotion, and nutrition education, as well as vision, hearing, speech, and dental screening. Services are coordinated through local school districts; no referral is required. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Home Health Office - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Offers health care and support services to adults with acute, chronic, palliative, or rehabilitative health care needs, as well as to support the transition from hospital release to home life; intake is required to assess eligibility. <strong>Home Support</strong> provides assistance with medications, bathing, and dressing for clients who are ill or recovering from illness or surgery, have physical disabilities, require personal assistance or respite for a caregiver, or need end-of-life care. <strong>Nursing Services</strong> may include assessment, education, counselling, and medical and surgical care at home. <strong>Physiotherapy and Occupational Therapy</strong> referrals are for clients who have a physical disability, are recovering from surgery or hospital stay, or who need rehabilitation or therapy to stay at home. Also provides assessment for access to <strong>Adult Day Services</strong> (day respite, health monitoring, therapeutic and recreational activities, and community bathing programs), and handles intake for publicly funded <strong>Assisted Living and Residential Care Facilities</strong>. Other services available may include personal care, medication assistance, respite care, nutrition consultation, and health education. Also provides access to specialty programs and services provided throughout the health authority. Serves Richmond. Intake and office hours are 9 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Home Health Office - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Offers health care and support services to adults with acute, chronic, palliative, or rehabilitative health care needs, as well as to support the transition from hospital release to home life; intake is required to assess eligibility. <strong>Home Support</strong> provides assistance with medications, bathing, and dressing for clients who are ill or recovering from illness or surgery, have physical disabilities, require personal assistance or respite for a caregiver, or need end-of-life care. <strong>Nursing Services</strong> may include assessment, education, counselling, and medical and surgical care at home. <strong>Physiotherapy and Occupational Therapy</strong> referrals are for clients who have a physical disability, are recovering from surgery or hospital stay, or who need rehabilitation or therapy to stay at home. Also provides assessment for access to <strong>Adult Day Services</strong> (day respite, health monitoring, therapeutic and recreational activities, and community bathing programs), and handles intake for publicly funded <strong>Assisted Living and Residential Care Facilities</strong>. Other services available may include personal care, medication assistance, respite care, nutrition consultation, and health education. Also provides access to specialty programs and services provided throughout the health authority. Serves Richmond. Intake and office hours are 9 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Youth Clinic - East Richmond Community Hall
Site.SiteDescription: Provides free, confidential information and education regarding sexuality and health to youth ages 12 to 20. Services include birth control, emergency contraception, and pregnancy testing and counselling, as well as testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections, pap tests, testing for HIV, and mental health and substance use counselling. Also refers youth to community support services such as counsellors and youth workers. BC Care Card is not needed to access these services. Serves Richmond. No referral required. Hours are 1 pm to 4 pm Tuesdays (drop-in or appointment); clinic is closed July through August.

SiteService.Name: Youth Clinic - East Richmond Community Hall
SiteService.Description: Provides free, confidential information and education regarding sexuality and health to youth ages 12 to 20. Services include birth control, emergency contraception, and pregnancy testing and counselling, as well as testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections, pap tests, testing for HIV, and mental health and substance use counselling. Also refers youth to community support services such as counsellors and youth workers. BC Care Card is not needed to access these services. Serves Richmond. No referral required. Hours are 1 pm to 4 pm Tuesdays (drop-in or appointment); clinic is closed July through August.

Site.Name: Mental Health Emergency Services
Site.SiteDescription: Provides mobile community mental health assessment and intervention to individuals experiencing a mental health crisis. Services include mobile assessments, and referrals to follow up with mental health services, health care professionals, or other agencies. Serves the city of Richmond (including Vancouver Airport). Hours are 11 am to 10 pm daily. Provides evening and weekend intervention, and support to individuals during non-office hours through the provision of crisis line service.

SiteService.Name: Mental Health Emergency Services
SiteService.Description: Provides mobile community mental health assessment and intervention to individuals experiencing a mental health crisis. Services include mobile assessments, and referrals to follow up with mental health services, health care professionals, or other agencies. Serves the city of Richmond (including Vancouver Airport). Hours are 11 am to 10 pm daily. Provides evening and weekend intervention, and support to individuals during non-office hours through the provision of crisis line service.

Site.Name: Mental Health Outpatient Services
Site.SiteDescription: Interdisciplinary team provides treatment for adults ages 19 and up with mental health issues related to mood and/or anxiety disorders and associated problems functioning. Provides a variety of therapies and psychiatric treatments. Referral required; form available online. Office open Monday to Friday; call for daily hours of operation.

SiteService.Name: Mental Health Outpatient Services
SiteService.Description: Interdisciplinary team provides treatment for adults ages 19 and up with mental health issues related to mood and/or anxiety disorders and associated problems functioning. Provides a variety of therapies and psychiatric treatments. Referral required; form available online. Office open Monday to Friday; call for daily hours of operation.

Site.Name: Rosewood Manor
Site.SiteDescription: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care; includes a specialty dementia unit. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Governed by Richmond Intermediate Care Society. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

SiteService.Name: Rosewood Manor
SiteService.Description: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care; includes a specialty dementia unit. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Governed by Richmond Intermediate Care Society. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

SiteService.Name: Rosewood Manor
SiteService.Description: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care; includes a specialty dementia unit. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

Site.Name: Gilwest Clinic
Site.SiteDescription: Provides HIV/AIDS and hepatitis C related services, including needle exchange.&nbsp;Also offers community development and education. Serves Richmond. Hours are 9 am to 11:30 am Mondays, 9 am to 12 noon Tuesdays, and 4 pm to 7 pm Thursdays.

SiteService.Name: Gilwest Clinic
SiteService.Description: Provides HIV/AIDS and hepatitis C related services, including needle exchange.&nbsp;Also offers community development and education. Serves Richmond. Hours are 9 am to 11:30 am Mondays, 9 am to 12 noon Tuesdays, and 4 pm to 7 pm Thursdays.

Site.Name: Health Protection Office - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Regulates and monitors public facilities and those aspects of the environment that have a direct impact on public health. Environmental Health Officers (EHOs) ensure that public health standards are met in restaurants and food service locations, public food handling and distribution, public swimming pools and hot tubs, and personal service establishments such as salons, spas, and tattoo parlours. Also takes steps to prevent injury and minimize the spread of communicable disease, and deals with drinking water safety. Prevents the display, promotion, and sale of tobacco and vapour products to minors, and protects the public and employees from the harmful effects of second-hand smoke through enforcement of provincial legislation. Licensing Officers ensure that residential and community care facilities comply with regulations. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Health Protection Office - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Regulates and monitors public facilities and those aspects of the environment that have a direct impact on public health. Environmental Health Officers (EHOs) ensure that public health standards are met in restaurants and food service locations, public food handling and distribution, public swimming pools and hot tubs, and personal service establishments such as salons, spas, and tattoo parlours. Also takes steps to prevent injury and minimize the spread of communicable disease, and deals with drinking water safety. Prevents the display, promotion, and sale of tobacco and vapour products to minors, and protects the public and employees from the harmful effects of second-hand smoke through enforcement of provincial legislation. Licensing Officers ensure that residential and community care facilities comply with regulations. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Eating Disorders Program - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Offers free, community-based assessments and treatment for individuals of any age who have an eating disorder and for their families. Treatment includes individual, group, or family counselling; medical monitoring; and nutritional support. Also offers consultation and education to community agencies and professional to promote early intervention and awareness. Offered in Cantonese, English, and Mandarin. Physician referral is required. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Funded in part by Ministry of Children and Family Development (MCFD).

SiteService.Name: Eating Disorders Program - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Offers free, community-based assessments and treatment for individuals of any age who have an eating disorder and for their families. Treatment includes individual, group, or family counselling; medical monitoring; and nutritional support. Also offers consultation and education to community agencies and professional to promote early intervention and awareness. Offered in Cantonese, English, and Mandarin. Physician referral is required. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Funded in part by Ministry of Children and Family Development (MCFD).

Site.Name: Adult Mental Health Program - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Provides community-based assessment and treatment for adults 19 years and up with functional impairment due to severe, persistent mental illness. Also provides specialized services for older adults with dementia-related behaviour or complex psychiatric and medical needs. Services include case management, outreach, and rehabilitation. Serves Richmond. Physician referral required. Open 8:15 am to 4:15 pm seven days a week.

SiteService.Name: Adult Mental Health Program - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Provides community-based assessment and treatment for adults 19 years and up with functional impairment due to severe, persistent mental illness. Also provides specialized services for older adults with dementia-related behaviour or complex psychiatric and medical needs. Services include case management, outreach, and rehabilitation. Serves Richmond. Physician referral required. Open 8:15 am to 4:15 pm seven days a week.

Site.Name: Transitions
Site.SiteDescription: Holistic recovery program supports people dealing with substance misuse, concurrent mental health issues, and/or mental health issues, utilizing a harm reduction framework. Offers screening, assessment, referral, counselling, psychiatric consultation, and education about relapse prevention, nutrition, and emotional management. Services include individual and group counselling, and educational support for people who are impacted by a family member's mental health or addiction issue. Acupuncture is also available. Accepts self-referrals; physician referrals only for mental health counselling services. Serves Richmond. Service may be available in Mandarin, depending on staff availability. Free interpretation service is available for various languages. Program hours are 8:30 am to 5 pm Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays; and 8:30 am to 7:30 pm Tuesdays.

SiteService.Name: Transitions
SiteService.Description: Holistic recovery program supports people dealing with substance misuse, concurrent mental health issues, and/or mental health issues, utilizing a harm reduction framework. Offers screening, assessment, referral, counselling, psychiatric consultation, and education about relapse prevention, nutrition, and emotional management. Services include individual and group counselling, and educational support for people who are impacted by a family member's mental health or addiction issue. Acupuncture is also available. Accepts self-referrals; physician referrals only for mental health counselling services. Serves Richmond. Service may be available in Mandarin, depending on staff availability. Free interpretation service is available for various languages. Program hours are 8:30 am to 5 pm Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays; and 8:30 am to 7:30 pm Tuesdays.

Site.Name: Adult Mental Health and Substance Use Services - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Provides central intake services for mental health and substance use services, which provide a range of health care and support services for adults ages 19 and up with mental health and/or substance use issues. Services include assessment, treatment, counselling, education, and referral to community resources. Also provides counselling to individuals who are concerned about someone else’s substance use. In addition, provides access to other specialty substance use and mental health services. Open referral. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:30 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Adult Mental Health and Substance Use Services - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Provides central intake services for mental health and substance use services, which provide a range of health care and support services for adults ages 19 and up with mental health and/or substance use issues. Services include assessment, treatment, counselling, education, and referral to community resources. Also provides counselling to individuals who are concerned about someone else’s substance use. In addition, provides access to other specialty substance use and mental health services. Open referral. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:30 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Child and Youth Mental Health - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: <strong>Psychiatric Clinic</strong> provides short-term assessment and treatment for children and youth ages five to 18 experiencing mental health concerns, except for ADHD and autism. Children and youth receive a psychiatric assessment and consultation with a psychiatrist. Open referral, including self-referral. <strong>Team Response to Adolescents and Children in Crisis (TRACC)</strong> provides emergency intervention for children and youth who are at moderate to high risk of suicide. Services offered in Cantonese, English, Mandarin, and Spanish. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Wednesday, 9 am to 7 pm Thursday, and 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Friday. Walk-in intake hours are 9 am to 3 pm on Thursdays; no appointment required.

SiteService.Name: Child and Youth Mental Health - Richmond
SiteService.Description: <strong>Psychiatric Clinic</strong> provides short-term assessment and treatment for children and youth ages five to 18 experiencing mental health concerns, except for ADHD and autism. Children and youth receive a psychiatric assessment and consultation with a psychiatrist. Open referral, including self-referral. <strong>Team Response to Adolescents and Children in Crisis (TRACC)</strong> provides emergency intervention for children and youth who are at moderate to high risk of suicide. Services offered in Cantonese, English, Mandarin, and Spanish. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Wednesday, 9 am to 7 pm Thursday, and 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Friday. Walk-in intake hours are 9 am to 3 pm on Thursdays; no appointment required.

Site.Name: Garratt Wellness Centre
Site.SiteDescription: Offers specialized programs, education, and resources to help individuals manage their chronic care needs. Team includes clinical educators, dietitians, nurses, physiotherapists, social workers, support staff, fitness instructors, and food skills for families facilitators. Services include nutrition counselling, chronic disease management, exercise programs, support programs, and community kitchens. Free interpretation service is available for various languages; must be pre-booked. Hours are 9 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday. Provided in partnership with City of Richmond.

SiteService.Name: Garratt Wellness Centre
SiteService.Description: Offers specialized programs, education, and resources to help individuals manage their chronic care needs. Team includes clinical educators, dietitians, nurses, physiotherapists, social workers, support staff, fitness instructors, and food skills for families facilitators. Services include nutrition counselling, chronic disease management, exercise programs, support programs, and community kitchens. Free interpretation service is available for various languages; must be pre-booked. Hours are 9 am to 5 pm Monday to Friday. Provided in partnership with City of Richmond.

Site.Name: Anne Vogel Clinic
Site.SiteDescription: Provides assessment, treatment, and primary care for individuals dealing with opiate dependence. An interdisciplinary team of doctors, occupational therapists, addictions counsellors, and a social worker offer a harm-reduction approach, providing needle exchange services for anyone wanting to dispose of used needles in a safe and legal way. Also provides clean needles, sterile water, alcohol wipes, and health information to encourage safer injecting practices. Offers methadone and suboxone treatment. Hosts an <strong>Opiate Users Group</strong> open to all at 11 am Mondays. Serves Richmond. Hours are 9 am to 5:30 pm Mondays, 9 am to 6 pm Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and 9 am to 5 pm Thursdays and Fridays.

SiteService.Name: Anne Vogel Clinic
SiteService.Description: Provides assessment, treatment, and primary care for individuals dealing with opiate dependence. An interdisciplinary team of doctors, occupational therapists, addictions counsellors, and a social worker offer a harm-reduction approach, providing needle exchange services for anyone wanting to dispose of used needles in a safe and legal way. Also provides clean needles, sterile water, alcohol wipes, and health information to encourage safer injecting practices. Offers methadone and suboxone treatment. Hosts an <strong>Opiate Users Group</strong> open to all at 11 am Mondays. Serves Richmond. Hours are 9 am to 5:30 pm Mondays, 9 am to 6 pm Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and 9 am to 5 pm Thursdays and Fridays.

Site.Name: Healthiest Babies Possible - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Prenatal outreach program to promote a healthy pregnancy for at-risk pregnant women ages 25 and up living in Richmond. Services offered include nutrition and prenatal lifestyle counselling; food supplement and prenatal vitamins; breastfeeding information; food coupons; labour and delivery information; community referrals; education about smoking, alcohol, and drug concerns; and prenatal and parent/infant groups. Home visits are available. Also partners with Youth Pregnancy and Parenting Program (YPPP) in Vancouver to offer youth-centred services and supports to clients 24 years and younger. Services and materials are offered in various languages; interpreters are also available. Self-referrals accepted. Hours are 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Healthiest Babies Possible - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Prenatal outreach program to promote a healthy pregnancy for at-risk pregnant women ages 25 and up living in Richmond. Services offered include nutrition and prenatal lifestyle counselling; food supplement and prenatal vitamins; breastfeeding information; food coupons; labour and delivery information; community referrals; education about smoking, alcohol, and drug concerns; and prenatal and parent/infant groups. Home visits are available. Also partners with Youth Pregnancy and Parenting Program (YPPP) in Vancouver to offer youth-centred services and supports to clients 24 years and younger. Services and materials are offered in various languages; interpreters are also available. Self-referrals accepted. Hours are 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Acute Home Based Treatment (AHBT) Program
Site.SiteDescription: Offers short-term, in-home acute psychiatric care for adults with increased symptoms or distress related to mental illness or substance use, as an alternative to hospitalization. Designed to provide individuals who are currently experiencing a psychiatric crisis the opportunity of choosing where they get their acute psychiatric treatment. A referral is required from a medical professional. Serves Richmond.

SiteService.Name: Acute Home Based Treatment (AHBT) Program
SiteService.Description: Offers short-term, in-home acute psychiatric care for adults with increased symptoms or distress related to mental illness or substance use, as an alternative to hospitalization. Designed to provide individuals who are currently experiencing a psychiatric crisis the opportunity of choosing where they get their acute psychiatric treatment. A referral is required from a medical professional. Serves Richmond.

Site.SiteDescription: Provides free, confidential information and education regarding sexuality and health to youth ages 12 to 20. Also refers youth to community support services such as counsellors and youth workers. BC Care Card is not needed to access these services. Serves Richmond. No referral required. Hours are 1 pm to 4 pm Tuesdays (drop-in or appointment); clinic is closed July through August.

Site.Name: Older Adult Mental Health and Substance Use Services - Richmond
Site.SiteDescription: Provides central intake services for mental health and substance use services, which provide a range of health care and support services for older adults ages 60&nbsp;and up with mental health and/or substance use issues. Services include assessment, treatment, counselling, education, and referral to community resources. Also provides counselling to individuals who are concerned about someone else’s substance use. In addition, provides access to other specialty substance use and mental health services. Open referral. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:15 am to 4:15 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Older Adult Mental Health and Substance Use Services - Richmond
SiteService.Description: Provides central intake services for mental health and substance use services, which provide a range of health care and support services for older adults ages 60&nbsp;and up with mental health and/or substance use issues. Services include assessment, treatment, counselling, education, and referral to community resources. Also provides counselling to individuals who are concerned about someone else’s substance use. In addition, provides access to other specialty substance use and mental health services. Open referral. Serves Richmond. Hours are 8:15 am to 4:15 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Minoru Residence
Site.SiteDescription: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Services include nursing and personal care, medication administration, meals, laundry service, and social and recreational activities. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Monthly rate is up to 80 percent of client's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.

SiteService.Name: Minoru Residence
SiteService.Description: Residential care facility for adults ages 19 and up with complex health care needs who require 24-hour care. Site.Name: Austin Harris Residence
Site.SiteDescription: Provides semi-independent housing for older adults ages 55 and up who require assistance with day-to-day activities such as medications, bathing, or life skills. Housing is intended for people who are able to make the range of decisions that allow them to live safely in a supportive, semi-independent environment. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Rent is 70 percent of applicant's after-tax income. Registered with the Assisted Living Registry, Ministry of Health. Funded by BC Housing.

SiteService.Name: Austin Harris Residence
SiteService.Description: Provides semi-independent housing for older adults ages 55 and up who require assistance with day-to-day activities such as medications, bathing, or life skills. Housing is intended for people who are able to make the range of decisions that allow them to live safely in a supportive, semi-independent environment. Referral required from Home Health office following a health care needs assessment; do not contact the facility directly. Rent is 70 percent of applicant's after-tax income. Funded by Vancouver Coastal Health.
